| HAPPY DECEMBER 1st YALL 🎄✨

HEALTHY BLONDES are always TRENDING - that healthy glow from the inside out 💫

insert - K18 🫶🏻 IYKYK
A leave-in treatment mask for all hair types that clinically reverses damage in 4 minutes.

+ 𝗵𝗼𝘄 𝘁𝗼 𝘂𝘀𝗲 𝗯𝗲𝗵𝗶𝗻𝗱 𝘁𝗵𝗲 𝗰𝗵𝗮𝗶𝗿: [can be used before any color/blonding service] 
step 1: apply in sections the k18 pro hair mist - 2-6 spritz (depending on length and density) + distribute evenly
wait 4 minutes
begin your color service 
step 2: shampoo hair but do not condition
apply k18 mask to towel dried hair, section by section
wait 4 minutes
don’t rinse this out 
style as desired!

r e p a i r
r e s t o r e 
s t r e n g t h e n
s o f t e n 
s m o o t h 
b o u n c e 

+ 𝗳𝗼𝗿 𝘁𝗵𝗲 𝗰𝗹𝗶𝗲𝗻𝘁𝘀: purchase the take home k18 treatment 

step 1: shampoo, do not condition! {i suggest double cleansing if you have skipped a few wash days}
step 2: towel dry your hair
step 3: work 1-2 pumps of product evenly into hair from ends to roots
step 4: let sit for 4 minutes to activate
do NOT rinse out
-Style your hair as usual
{if you have other products you want to put in wait the 4 minutes than apply other products!}

everyone deserves this under their christmas tree this year! 😘

You can purchase the pro from their website or now available at @saloncentric !
For take home products visit @citrine.salon ✨

TIME is money [we’ve all heard that saying, right?] but so is product! ⚡️

Working in a service industry we are not only allocating for our time but the products we use!

insert @salonscale 🫶🏻

a one of kind system that is a scale + app that connects via bluetooth + measures and calculates in real time what products you use!

+ if you want to truly dial in, you can track even your gloves + foils!🤯

KNOW your exact product usage per client
KEEP track of all your formulas
and feel CONFIDENT in your pricing!

Inflation is at an all time high + products are increasing more frequently then normal.
If you haven’t done a price increase, now is the time to dial in on your numbers.
Each year most companies increase 5-10% + 9/10 it is done to match the increase of product costs that are happening behind the scenes!

This is the perfect time to implement new changes going into a new year! I hope this inspires you to check in on your business!

Have any questions on how i implement this in my business send me a DM! If your curious on how it’s all set up @salonscale works together with you and makes the intro so easy!

Use my code ALLYSON10 at checkout to save! Link in bio sista, this is your sign to level up! ⚡️

| hair health should always be top priority ✨

damage is ongoing with our hair, whether it’s color/lightening services, heat styling, environment etc, we put our hair through a lot!
and if we aren’t using treatments to help treat/replenish, our hair suffers.

k18 is a molecular hair treatment that reconnects polypeptide chains + disulfide bonds to renew strength, elasticity and overall health of the hair in 4 freakin’ minutes 🤯

WHY i choose to carry and recommend @k18 in salon treatment + take home👇🏼
i use the k18 mask every other wash on my hair so i speak from experience 🫶🏻
— works fast [4 minutes]
— no extra rinsing
— 2 step in salon treatment that adds extra protection for the transformative hair services / blonded babes
— reverses damage from lightening or heat styling
— protects from future damage
— leaves your hair feeling and looking healthy
— instant results + even better with continued use
— my clients LOVE it

add this onto your next service, healthy hair glows ✨

STYLISTS! let’s ADD VALUE!
k18 is one of the best treatments there is on the market right now. offering k18 behind the chair [the professional 2 step treatment] will not only benefit your clients hair + make your work look beautiful BUT adds extra revenue for you!
Utilizing k18 as an add on or bundling it into your services will add SO much value AND add k18 to your retail area so clients can take advantage of the benefits of this treatment at home!

3 TIPS FOR HAIRLINE DETAILING //

— have a plan, this babe wanted a money piece poppin’ - so knowing your placement for this look is key VS a more fine hairline detailing
— small sections are key for that lift
— back to back weaves feathering towards root for the blend
— low volume for healthy hair 
— using @trussprofessional air libre + my @oliviagarden_int brush to blend at the shampoo bowl

| FLIP IT + REVERSE IT

when Jenn was ready to let go of her platinum hair the first time i was like okay let’s tip toe into this change, this sesh we dove right in 🏊🏻‍♀️ utilzing my signature reverse citrine babe glow service + a face frame.

*my biggest tip when melting or low lighting a blonde who is always use to being blonde is make sure they still feel blonde around their face. 

HAIR BREAKDOWN ———

— @trussprofessional blanc blonde for her face frame [y’all know this lightener is my FAV]
always using @styletekbeauty foils - this blue color has been my fav lately 🦋

— @paulmitchellpro the demi 6n 6a 6g to root melt on dry hair for maximum deposit

— same formula to add lows into her canvas - splitting the hair into 2 halves and working on a diagonal back with larger pick ups but very fine for even saturation

once root is applied i wet the transition area and use my @oliviagarden_int iblend brush to create seamless transitions / same with lows

| a brunette with those soft pops 🫶🏻

@becatsguest comes in today and i have no idea what we are doing, blonde or brunette 👀

but one thing i do know is she likes to keep it lived in for a seamless grow out + easy maintenance,

i will forever love creating lived in hair.

what is lived in hair?

color that is purposefully placed + blended to grow in beautifully, allowing you to go months in between blonding sessions.

multiple techniques will be used to create a desired look + a root shadow or root melt add on will be needed to create the desired look. lived in hair is so customizable! scroll through my page to see more inspo!

Use your IG to share the work you ENJOY doing and this will curate a clientele that wants the work you put out, in turn making you a happy stylist because your doing hair you LOVE and clients will reap the benefits of you or pursuing that passion 💓

If your ready to up level your business BTC i have a few dates for 1 on 1 classes left!
If you are looking to be a host salon, or to set up a private class for your team, send me a DM!

| brighter + blonder ✨🧚🏼‍♂️

3 tips on keeping your blonde bright + healthy at home:

- skip wash days - the more you wash your hair the more you are stripping your natural oils and your toner - which dulls your color - reach for a dry shampoo + get creative with styles.

- your products matter - a quality shampoo + conditioner (for blondes), mask (to hydrate) and leave in product (heat protectant) is necessary to keep your hair healthy and your tone to last!

- invest in a filter for your shower head - this will help remove hard water + minerals that tend to dull your blonde

| what products you use and how you apply them matters 🫶🏻

first, your stylist recommendations over anyone because they know your hair best. [just sayin’] you may think your hair is thick but really it’s fine texture and you have a lot of density. and knowing this can be a game changer for how products work on your hair or how many days you can go in between washing 💓🫧

NEXT - push the product into the hair, don’t rub it in, that roughs the cuticle of the hair up causing frizz 👹 

clients keep this in mind when using styling products at home! and stylists, educating your clients is always #1! 😘

| We sound like we speak a different language sometimes, i know! 😅
[ babylights, macrolights, balayage, lived in color, money piece, shadow root, root melt — the list goes on]

Knowing what to ask your stylist for is necessary to the outcome of your hair, but don’t get caught up on the terms!

Photos are great to reference too, so if you don’t have a picture or if i feel like we aren’t on the same page during the consultation
- i will ask if you have some inspo or if we can find some inspo! [remember pictures are for inspiration not duplication] 

This is a blonding appointment that entails a mixture of babylights + highlights paired with a root shadow for longevity and blend. [isn’t her hair dreamy 😍]

Here are a few questions to ask when being shown an inspo pic: 👇🏼

- What do you love about this photo? (tone, placement)

- Do you not like anything in this photo?

- Are you looking to make any changes to your haircut today? (this helps with color placement)

- Do you like solid blonded ends or would you like dimension running through?

- Do you like brightness around the face? (money piece, soft brightness)

- Do you want your blonde all the way to the root, or a few inches from root?

- Do you want to see dimension/ contrast?

These are just a few questions i ask to my clients in my chair to get a better idea of what they are seeing in the photos.

I hope this helps; and SAVE to refer back to this later!

| hair transformations + morgan wallen — now those are 2 things i LOVEEEE, wbu 😜

my client Caroline told me she wanted to cut her hair and go a little darker making her natural color more prominent, but still keep brightness around her face and slight dimension throughout. and then told me do whatever you want with that 😍 

i approached this by knowing i needed to create a lot more depth and dimension i started with rooting her first - then using water to melt and create a seamless transition [ @oliviagarden_int iblend brush always] - then went in with varying weave pick ups to create lowlights and left small amounts of her previous color out to keep dimension running through her ends.
the most important part to approaching a transition like this is being intentional with the placement of your melt and lowlights.

my client was getting permanent color done to cover her sparkles (it’s what we call gray hair at @citrine.salon ) - BUT she doesn’t have that many where i would personally say let’s use permanent color. 
obviously it’s always up to your client but my favorite question to ask is “do you want to see them completely gone or can we tint them and blend them in?” 

so we switched her over to @paulmitchellpro the demi - and now her look is softer, her blonde is the goal blonde she wanted to achieve.
So we can create soft dimension with the demi if needed, blend in her sparkles and call it a day! 😍

this is your sign to always have the conversations with your clients and be open and honest! whether they are new to your chair or have been coming to you for years. 🤍

——— packed in the foils for this #citrinebabe ✨
her natural canvas is a level 6 + she had previous blonding from a prior sesh with me + her goal was to be super BLONDE!

do you get 𝑜𝑣𝑒𝑟𝑤ℎ𝑒𝑙𝑚𝑒𝑑 when creating a 𝑡𝑟𝑎𝑛𝑠𝑓𝑜𝑟𝑚𝑎𝑡𝑖𝑜𝑛 like this?
i’ve got some tips for yah 🫶🏻

1. 𝘂𝗻𝗱𝗲𝗿 𝗽𝗿𝗼𝗺𝗶𝘀𝗲 + 𝗼𝘃𝗲𝗿 𝗱𝗲𝗹𝗶𝘃𝗲𝗿 - we don’t know exactly how hair is going to lift / what is on their hair etc many factors can alter what happens in a foil + hair integrity is #1 - so being honest and communicating that a transformation like such may take more than one session during the consultation is necessary. and if magic happens great, and if it doesn’t they already are prepped + excited for the next session!

2. 𝘄𝗼𝗿𝗸 𝘀𝗺𝗮𝗿𝘁𝗲𝗿 - 𝗻𝗼𝘁 𝗵𝗮𝗿𝗱𝗲𝗿 - keep it simple with placement + don’t overthink it babe. it’s always great to have a few go to placements in your mind that create certain looks + you can customize to each canvas. it makes you less overwhelmed and work intentionally.
i did a heavy full head placement of fine slices finished with a root tap. her goal was to be blonde (why i chose slices- more coverage less dimension) and have a soft transition at her root so when it grows in it isn’t very harsh.

3. 𝗗𝗼𝗻’𝘁 𝗳𝗼𝗿𝗴𝗲𝘁 to talk about take home products! Not only does this show you care about what they are using on their hair at home to maintain what you just created, but it builds trust. (you know their hair best as their stylist) Take home products are essential to keeping the hair healthy + as gorgeous as when they leave the salon! This babes main purchase was @k18hair treatment to keep her hair healthy and strong in between sessions.

——— Are you team money piece?! 💸🤍😎

Whether you want it BOLD, or soft + subtle - face framing highlights can be completely customized to your desired look!
I am loving the impact but softness of this babes face frame, wbu?!

𝗧𝗶𝗽𝘀 𝗼𝗻 𝗛𝗢𝗪 𝘁𝗼 𝗰𝗿𝗲𝗮𝘁𝗲 𝘁𝗵𝗲 𝗽𝗲𝗿𝗳𝗲𝗰𝘁 𝗺𝗼𝗻𝗲𝘆 𝗽𝗶𝗲𝗰𝗲 👇🏼

01. determine their part and placement of money piece- being aware of their hairline and how the hair falls naturally will determine how much or how little you need to section out for it.

02. determine placement of foils - if i want a more natural face frame i work off each side of the part - if i want a more bold face frame i work in a mohawk section placement.

03. type of pick ups is important when creating the face frame - you want them to be small babylights to blend when they pull their hair back - weaving right off the scalp. you can also utilize micro slices depending on the canvas.
keep in mind the amount of hair you have in the foil and how many foils you will need to create the desired look - 𝐛𝐞 𝐢𝐧𝐭𝐞𝐧𝐭𝐢𝐨𝐧𝐚𝐥 𝐰𝐢𝐭𝐡 𝐲𝐨𝐮𝐫 𝐩𝐥𝐚𝐜𝐞𝐦𝐞𝐧𝐭.

04. i always finish with a teasylight - i feel this transitions the money piece / face frame into the rest of the hair softly without having to go add the extra step of a shadow or melt.

05. and last but not least the type of lightener your using and developer is important! i LOVE @trussprofessional blanc blonde gentle but packs a punch - and if you aren’t a fast foiler drop your developer when it comes to framing the face - those hairs are much more fragile then everything else!

Do you love the look of 𝙙𝙞𝙢𝙚𝙣𝙨𝙞𝙤𝙣 in the hair?!

Dimension is different types of tones in the hair. The benefits of adding dimension is a change in your color, adds the look of fullness and can make your blonde look blonder!

𝗪𝗲 𝗵𝗮𝘃𝗲 𝟯 𝘁𝗶𝗽𝘀 𝘄𝗵𝗲𝗻 𝗶𝘁 𝗰𝗼𝗺𝗲𝘀 𝘁𝗼 𝗱𝗶𝗺𝗲𝗻𝘀𝗶𝗼𝗻 𝘁𝗼 𝘀𝗵𝗮𝗿𝗲 𝘄𝗶𝘁𝗵 𝘆𝗼𝘂 𝘁𝗼𝗱𝗮𝘆!

1. Dimension is created over time, through sessions! Each session when you are getting blonding (foils, balayage etc) some hair lifts more and some hair is left out from previous session and in turn creates dimension!

2. If you feel too blonded and want to add dimension, you can! Your stylist will add a lowlight (don’t get scared of that word, we promise it won’t be black!) which will add depth and dimension to your canvas again!

3. You really see dimension in the hair when it is waved or curled! Like above! 😍

Want to add some dimension in your hair?!

I’m curious! Honestly for me it’s just a “trend” + a an easy caption to give my color 😅, and as long as i have some inspiration pictures i can formulate and create my own version!

This is your sign 🪧 to not get caught up in the trendy names of colors (like #cowboycopper) 
keep it simple babe + use your knowledge to create!

——— and just like that 🪄 we are a BRUNETTE BABE now ⚡️

Yes, my friend Heather sat down wanting to go brunette. 😍
Did i ask her a million questions before we started? heck yes, because we’ve been making her blonde for a bit now.
BUT i am ALWAYS down for some change, and if my client wants it i will deliver! (unless i don’t think it’s a good idea; you can always count on me to be 110% honest!)

✨ My top 2 questions i ask when a client wants to go from blonde to brunette are:

01. How long have you been thinking about this change?
02. How committed are you to this new look? Are you thinking your going to want to go back blonde within the next session or 2? (9/10 i always use a demi color but there are clients who want to jump to permanent color - so i always discuss the pro and cons)

——
HOW i created her new look |
using all @paulmitchellpro the demi
- apply root and melt down
- i then go in placing foils of weaves of a lighter tone - in her case we used a level 8 for dimension around her face and throughout. this will help me intentionally place lightness and see how much hair is left out for balance.
- then everything left out of the foils i applied another glaze (keeping in mind that we need to fill - natural ash gold NAG and add a little red/copper) 

i LOVEEEEEE @paulmitchellpro the demi’s the tones are so beautiful + rich and leaves the hair so shiney and healthy! 🫶🏻✨

i always teach my assistants the importance of starting around the face when blowdrying!
𝑠𝑜 ℎ𝑒𝑟𝑒’𝑠 𝑦𝑜𝑢𝑟 𝑟𝑒𝑚𝑖𝑛𝑑𝑒𝑟 𝑏𝑎𝑏𝑒 ⚡️

starting where their part is like i did in the video and than moving to  each side - then tackle the back - it’s all about 𝐢𝐧𝐭𝐞𝐧𝐭𝐢𝐨𝐧 and 𝐞𝐟𝐟𝐢𝐜𝐢𝐞𝐧𝐜𝐲!

notice i am allowing space between my blowdryer and brush and not pressing my blowdryer to the brush this helps prolong the quality of your tools and let’s the air circulate properly drying the hair efficiently.

+ always making sure you are drying the hair 100% - before letting that section go 💨 watch as i manipulate the hair in different directions to make sure of this

——— 3 ways to upgrade your blonde babes that sit in your chair ✔️

01. shadow root - creates longevity with their blonding (can be formulated to soften highlights or create depth + shadow)

02. add back in some depth - there is no brightness without a little depth - i love adding in midlights which are lowlights that go mid way down - they customize your clients look and make their color pop more

03. treat their hair - educate them on the importance of treatments/products. one thing i hear new clients say to me often is how i prioritize the health of the hair + that my blondes always look healthy. this is because i am talking about the importance of replenishing the hair after lightening or while lightening. AND i am talking about it on here. my clients begin to learn and understand the importance of treating their hair just by seeing the results!
stylists - this also goes into being mindful of placement - overlapping and being intentional with your work.

at my salon, @citrine.salon i teach my stylists + assistants the importance of talking about treatments/educating the client on what may be best for them. as their stylist you know their hair better then IG or TIK TOK 🫶🏻 am i right?!
and healthy hair is pretty hair - and it shows!

𝗟𝗘𝗧’𝗦 𝗧𝗔𝗟𝗞 𝗔𝗕𝗢𝗨𝗧 𝗜𝗧 👇🏼

01. No one knows who you are unless you tell them. People do business with people they know, like, and trust. And if they don’t know WHO you are, WHAT you do/specialize in, what you can offer them/help them with - you may not be chosen. We have this great platform to express all of those things, take advantage of it!

02. Attracting your dream clientele - Have you had the moment where Sally sucked the soul out of you, or Mary wanted chunky highlights and that’s just not your thing. That’s okay, you can start to showcase your work and attract your DREAM clientele. Take a moment to envision this - you go into work; you set up your station; check your schedule, see all these clients who requested you, create gorgeous hair + leave feeling fulfilled because each client that sat in your chair you had great convo with, they brought inspo off your ig and you nailed their vision!

03. Do you want to be where you are at now, 6 months from now? Or do you want growth, your ideal clientele and more income. It’s common to feel like i know i should be posting but you don’t, or what should i post. (i’ve got something exciting coming for stylists/salon owners) but in the mean time - post the photo/video/reel - make the content and share who you are and what you do.

——— BTS 🎥 of a root color + custom blonding

did you peep @styletekbeauty cutie halloween foils?! love a fun foil 👻🎃 have you grabbed a box?!

sharing some TIPS on gray coverage / root color + blonding at the same time — 👇🏼

01. be mindful of your root application - clean and using a brush after you apply to blend softly
02. i avoid meeting the lightener into the color 
03. if/when your teasing - i like to keep my tease in the middle and not get any root color on it to avoid any spots - so visualize root color, tease, lightener faded up near the tease (creates natural gradient)
04. and chat with your client explaining that when using permanent color at your base and wanting to add lightness you will forever battle warm tones because of breaking through permanent color - if icy, white or cool is your goal, let go of permanent color ✌🏼

—— READ BELOW to make your foiling techniques more intentional + your client experience better! ✨

SAVE THESE TIPS! 👇🏼

01. Use your hand as a board under your foil when applying lightener this will allow thorough saturation (lift)

02. Lock your foils - when i learned this years ago it changed the game for me

03. Don’t go crazy folding your foils - you will cut down your foiling time by doing this and not manipulating the hair and lightener in the foil which can cause a bleeder

04. Intentional placement - where do you want to see brightness where do we need to leave depth - and don’t overthink it - the biggest thing i hear in my classes and 1 on 1’s is the struggle with overfoiling
which also goes into 𝑊𝑜𝑟𝑘 𝑠𝑚𝑎𝑟𝑡𝑒𝑟 𝑛𝑜𝑡 ℎ𝑎𝑟𝑑𝑒𝑟 , being purposeful with your placement allows you to foil with ease and not overthink your application.

and last but most important:

05. Make sure your client is always comfortable - fold foils away from their face - make sure no random hairs are falling into their face - make it an enjoyable experience it’s the little things that matter y’all. 

Hope these tips help and you all have a kick ass day behind the chair! 🫶🏻

——— all blondes fade warm 💛

as beautifully toned you may leave the salon, in 4-6 or 6-8 weeks depending on many factors like 👇🏼
- your hairs health (why treatments are always a must when your a blonde)
- the porosity of your hair
- how often you wash your hair
- the products you use at home
- hard water
and toners are demi color which means they fade on tone over time, so the yellow/orange or natural lifted pigment will always end up resurfacing

This is your reminder to make sure you invest in at home hair care that your stylist recommends and book those maintenance appointments babe 🤍

——— COLOR CORRECT 🎥

— this is your sign to not believe everything tik tok tells/shows you when it comes to the hair world 😅 box color is not the vibe

but we fixed her right up 😍👏🏼

with color corrections you never know exactly what your getting yourself into - how the box color will react with lightener, if you get an even lift or need to zone tone etc

thankfully the hair gods where on my side with this one 🙏🏼

my biggest piece of advice when it comes to color corrections [+ with any hair appt because there can be so many variables] —
𝒖𝒏𝒅𝒆𝒓𝒑𝒓𝒐𝒎𝒊𝒔𝒆 - 𝒐𝒗𝒆𝒓𝒅𝒆𝒍𝒊𝒗𝒆𝒓 
go 𝒃𝒂𝒄𝒌 𝒕𝒐 𝒃𝒂𝒔𝒊𝒄𝒔 - 𝒄𝒐𝒍𝒐𝒓 𝒕𝒉𝒆𝒐𝒓𝒚 + be 𝒊𝒏𝒕𝒆𝒏𝒕𝒊𝒐𝒏𝒂𝒍 𝒘𝒊𝒕𝒉 𝒑𝒍𝒂𝒄𝒆𝒎𝒆𝒏𝒕 + take on 𝒆𝒂𝒄𝒉 𝒔𝒆𝒄𝒕𝒊𝒐𝒏 𝒂𝒔 𝒊𝒕’𝒔 𝒐𝒘𝒏

+ hair appt breakdown |
teasys with intentional pick ups
root melt
global glaze
treatment (helping with porosity and any damage/dryness)
haircut
the works for this #citrinebabe and the next time i’ll see her is in April and this will grow in beautiful for her!

**not always are color corrections a one session situation - sometimes they will take multiple sessions to achieve the goal hair or an even canvas**

——— that Saturday GLOW up ✨

3 reasons why you should cut those dead ends ✂️
- prevent further damage/breakage [split ends will continue to split up the hair if you don’t cut them off, creating shorter lengths in the hair]
- instant hair fullness [hello thicker looking hair]
- and letting go of what no longer serves us, and beginning new … is a v i b e 👏🏼

Vanilla Chai Blonde ☕️ - it's that in-between where you're not a blonde, but you're also not a brunette - it's giving BRONDE feels.⁣

If you get blonding done, and don't quite need a full blonding service yet but want to keep your hai feeling bright and fresh, come see us for one of our MINI signature services at Citrine!

SAVE THIS to refer back to 🤎

- remove excess water 
- lift head + lay towel horizontally
- meet both ends at the top of their forehead
- grab right corner and bring up to meet those
- tuck hair into towel
- grab last corner swoop up and tuck into the towel (not the hairline)

——— Hair is most fragile when it’s wet. Here are some of my top tips to protecting your hair when wet.

It’s the small habits that we do that help our hair stay healthy!

01. Use a leave in conditioner or detangling product applied before brushing.
- my favorites |  @amika vault leave in or wizard @trussprofessional amino [depending on hair type!]
02. Brush gently from the bottom up releasing any tangles and knots.
03. Don’t go to bed with wet hair 😣 This creates frizz, tangles, scalp issues and damages your hair. 

Implementing these tips will help your hair stay healthy, not break, and protect it so it continues to grow!

——— 2024 TRENDS ✨

- bye overly waved hair - loose texture, like a slight bend in the hair + more of a volume blowdry

- really blonded hair will be out - this has been a thing now for a bit, but will trend even more in 2024. hair color will fully embrace that organic, lived-in aesthetic, having a more soft look and soft grow out is the vibe. 

- healthy hair - i love this one because so many of my clients have been opting to add on @k18hair treatments to their services and it is 10/10 worth it! healthy hair is beautiful hair, and if your blonding you should always be treating!
[if your a client and have any questions about k18 or if you’re a stylist and want to know how to talk about it with clients, let me know! i’d love to share!]

- old money blonde - you may have heard this term floating around IG - this type of color has easily been most requested + is when the goal is a softer blonde, not so bleached out looking. while a creamy bright blonde is still trending, we are moving away from the white icy blondes to more natural, but still feeling bright blonded looks! [like above!]

- haircut trends - short bobs, bangs, + very layered haircuts that are easy to style and let be

——— Let’s take a moment to show some assistant loveeeeee! 🥰
yesterday i wrapped up my last day of clients, and maternity leave from behind the chair has begun for me!
a BIG shoutout to my assistant @esmeralda.doeshair who has made the last few months flow + helped me deliver an amazing experience to all my clients 🫶🏻
- we gotta give it to her, she handles my chaotic schedule + is always one step ahead! grateful for you E!

i remember being an assistant but my experience was nothing like it is today. 
i truly just shampooed, ran errands [like getting my boss grapes every day for lunch - not lying], and cleaned. i learned work ethic and starting from the bottom, to truly work your way up.

𝘁𝗶𝗺𝗲𝘀 𝗵𝗮𝘃𝗲 𝗰𝗵𝗮𝗻𝗴𝗲𝗱 𝘁𝗵𝗼𝘂𝗴𝗵 - 𝗶𝗳 𝘆𝗼𝘂’𝗿𝗲 𝗮𝗻 𝗼𝘄𝗻𝗲𝗿 𝗼𝗿 𝘀𝘁𝘆𝗹𝗶𝘀𝘁 𝘄𝗵𝗼 𝗵𝗮𝘀 𝗵𝗶𝗿𝗲𝗱 𝗮𝗻 𝗮𝘀𝘀𝗶𝘀𝘁𝗮𝗻𝘁, 𝗵𝗮𝘃𝗲 𝘆𝗼𝘂 𝘀𝗲𝗲𝗻 𝘁𝗵𝗶𝘀 𝘀𝗵𝗶𝗳𝘁 𝗶𝗻 𝗼𝘂𝗿 𝗶𝗻𝗱𝘂𝘀𝘁𝗿𝘆?

assistants are more like apprentices now - more hands on - the stylist is teaching as they are working + it delivers an experience.
alongside the daily duties of the salon of course, and assistant programs are more prominent.

i’ve also noticed not as many stylists opt for an assistant- they choose to take less people a day, raise their prices to accommodate for that and book out.
𝗱𝗼 𝘆𝗼𝘂 𝘂𝘁𝗶𝗹𝗶𝘇𝗲 𝗮𝗻 𝗮𝘀𝘀𝗶𝘀𝘁𝗮𝗻𝘁?

i would say 𝙢𝙮 𝙗𝙞𝙜𝙜𝙚𝙨𝙩 𝙖𝙙𝙫𝙞𝙘𝙚 when it comes to hiring an assistant
- know that you can pay them without it decreasing your income - assistants can help you make more + deliver a great experience.

- hire based on eagerness, motivation, work ethic and the desire to grow- growth based mindset and the passion/hunger for the industry - everything else you can teach and train. 

- know their role - and it isn’t just to help you shampoo and stay on time - they are there to help but also learn + you are a mentor to them. there is a reason they chose to work/grow alongside you. and know that it may not be for a long time but you were apart of their journey - and that is amazing!
